title: CJK letters in rustdoc are not rendered in serif font when using Firefox

labels.name: T-rustdoc
labels.description: Relevant to the rustdoc team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

CJK letters in rustdoc are not rendered in serif font when using Firefox, although Chromium Edge renders them correctly.

### Steps to reproduce:
Open https://docs.rs/koyomi/0.3.0/koyomi/fn.era.html (Japanese) or https://docs.rs/chinese-variant/1.0.7/chinese_variant/ (Chinese) in Firefox.

Alternatively, run `cargo doc` command to generate a document including CJK letters, and open it in Firefox.

### Expected result:
CJK letters should be rendered in serif font, as ASCII letters. 

Here are screenshots of rendering by Chromium Edge (v85.0.564.51) on Windows 10 v1909. Here, CJK letters are rendered in serif font.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53166653/93020005-bcc51480-f615-11ea-9014-dd552a65d401.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53166653/93020318-49240700-f617-11ea-96b1-53250fe67958.png)

### Actual result:
With using Firefox v80.0.1 on Windows 10 v1909, CJK letters are not rendered in serif font, but in the browser's default font (san-serif font). Note that ASCII letters are rendered in serif font.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53166653/93020010-c189c880-f615-11ea-9b31-1a42bea1ff4c.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/53166653/93020326-5214d880-f617-11ea-9353-bd5941d2063e.png)
